FuncDef:
The records command sets the maximum number of history and result records that can be saved for an NQA test instance.
The undo records command restores the default maximum value. The records command sets the maximum number of history and result records that can be saved for an NQA test instance. The undo records command restores the default maximum value. By default, the maximum number of history records is 60, the maximum number of result records is 5.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the maximum number of result records that the device can save for each NQA test instance.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 10.

Specifies the maximum number of history records that the device can save for each NQA test instance.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 1000.

ExtraInfo: The result and history records of an NQA test instance are recorded in the result table and history table, respectively. You can run the following commands to query the result and history statistics and evaluate network quality.
